titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:11-0400

did.abstract: Linguistic field recordings of the Nez Percé language. Consists predominantly of elicitation sessions regarding Nez Percé kinships terms, adjectives, grammar, and number, with frequent intermixed discussion. Recorded by Shila Baksi with consultant Horace Axtell in Lewiston, Idaho from April 1988 to May 1989.
did.physdesc: 20 sound cassettes (19 hr., 42 min.) : analog, 1 7/8 ips, stereo.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by Shila Baksi in 1990 (Acc. 1990-585r). This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Material
relatedmaterial.p: Transcripts of these recordings are available in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Audiocassette) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.
